tool.name: bwameth
tool.description: Fast and accurate aligner of BS-Seq reads.
tool.command:
#if $referenceSource.source != "indexed": mkdir index_dir && ln -s '$referenceSource.reference' index_dir/genome.fa && bwameth.py index index_dir/genome.fa && #set index="index_dir/genome.fa" #else #set index=$referenceSource.index.fields.path #end if
bwameth.py -t "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}" --reference "${index}"
#if str($readGroup).strip() != "": --read-group "${readGroup}" #end if
#if $single_or_paired.single_or_paired_opts == 'single': $single_or_paired.input_singles #elif $single_or_paired.single_or_paired_opts == 'paired': $single_or_paired.input_mate1 $single_or_paired.input_mate2 #else: $single_or_paired.input_mate1.forward $single_or_paired.input_mate1.reverse #end if | samtools view -u - | samtools sort -@ "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}" -o output.bam -

param.name: source
param.label: Select a genome reference from your history or a built-in index?

param.name: index
param.label: Select a reference genome
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact your Galaxy admin

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: readGroup
param.label: Read group
param.help: If desired, you can manually add read group information to the resulting BAM file. To do so, you MUST manually specify the entire string, such as '@RG\tID:foo\tSM:bar'

tool.help:
**What it does**
BWA-meth performs alignment of reads in a bisulfite-sequencing experiment (e.g., RRBS or WGBS) to a genome. The methodology employed for this is similar to bismark, where both the reads and the reference genome are *in silico* converted prior to alignment. Methylation extraction on the resulting BAM file can be done with the PileOMeth tool.
